channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024040312
item.description:
Report E-2024040312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight observed one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident that punctured the container. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleanup the released material and overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum along with the cleanup debris.

item.title: Report X-2024040678
item.description:
Report X-2024040678

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: ROLLA
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024040678 SequenceEvent: When unloading the trailer the box was discovered to be wet due to leakage from within the box. DescribePack: the package does not appear to have any holes in it. It looks like the cap was not on securely. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the box was segregated from other boxes and placed into a hazmat tote. 2. X-2024040704 SequenceEvent: The package was sent up the belt and upon picking up the package the package handler discovered the box was leaking. The box was segregated from other packages and placed into a hazmat tote and taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: The top was not screwed on tightly DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: There was no spillage on the van line and the employee who got some on their skin went to a sink and rinsed off. The liquid was on the box.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was retrieved from delivery van by package handlers, and was being transported on a tugger cart. The packaged was noticed to be leaking. Upon discovery, QA was notified and contained the package. There was no apparent spillage on other packages or environment. DescribePack: The lid/closure was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report E-2024040257
item.description:
Report E-2024040257

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2874 was damaged due to a shipping error and released approximately one-eighth (1/8) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN2874-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum was then placed into one (1) additional 85-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040235
item.description:
Report X-2024040235

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During unloading the box was in poor condition the closure was open and corner needed to be taped. It was located on the rollers and taken to Q/A because one of the items was leaking.The item leaking was the non-hazardous universal mounting paste, when a DPR was started it was discovered that the other three item in the box were hazardous and very minor leakage from the Cleaner Fluid (drops) that this HESS report is for. Tire Bead Sealer UN1133 Adhesives Flammable Liquid PG II, did not leak; Tire Repair Cement UN1133 Adhesives Flammable Liquid PGII. did not leak. No hazardous labels on package/Fedex label or billing showing hazardous. DescribePack: Closure open no inner pack, items just hitting each other. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: placed bottle in upright position

item.title: Report X-2024040150
item.description:
Report X-2024040150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UN 1845 DRY ICE shipment was damaged during sort operations. Outer packaging was a Styrofoam box that contained dry ice and what appeared to be medical supplies (2514088-INSULIN HUMAN ACF USP/EP). The dry ice did escape the box and found on the floor of the ULD. All contents were placed into an open sort bag and held pending disposition from the shipper.
